reviews.text: This hotel is one of the earliest five star hotels in town so the facilities are a little outdated. Room is small as compared to other Shangri-la hotels that I have stayed at. Food in the cafe is excellent, although the environment could be further improved. I dined twice at the Shang Place and both the food and service are good. Price is reasonable for both room and food, but maybe high by local standard as living cost in Wuhan is relatively low as compared to other big cities. Staff is unanimously friendly and trying to help. Some major construction on subway is going on in the area and traffic can be an issue.
reviews.title: Friendly staff

reviews.text: This is my third time at the Shangri-La in Wuhan and it's always a treat for me to return. I've been to more luxurious Shangri-La's, but none as friendly. Its smaller footprint and "Wuhanese" hospitality always make me feel at home. There is some construction happening nearby - but that can be said for much of anywhere in China. I'm sure it's just a matter of time before more western 5 star hotels are built in Wuhan, but I will continue to stay here.
reviews.title: Always at home at Shangri-La Wuhan

reviews.text: I was given less privilege here in Wuhan Shangrila than the other Shangrila hotels provide me despite I am a loyal member . The staff needs to learn more about hospitality. And be able to provide service that make guests happy.

Hotel appearance and management of hotel is so friendly & familiar with the guest. I had very excellent experience with hotel duty manager and her team. Nice lounge appearance with variety of tea's & cocktails.

reviews.text: Except for road works going on right now in the area, it is a good location for both business and leisure. Easy access to airport, train station, shopping, entertainment and river bank attractions. It has arguably the best lobby bar which is good for quiet chats and relaxation. Breakfast spread is a good mix of east-west fares.
reviews.title: Still the best in Wuhan north side of the River

reviews.text: I always look forward to my stay at the Shangri-La Wuhan, I have stayed in most of the trip advisor top 10 hotels in Wuhan, but have to say that for me the Shangri-La is the best. All front desk, bell boys, waiters etc. speak good English, rooms are nice and espcially the beds are very comfortable. It offers the same level of quality/luxury as the Shangri-la Shanghai or Beijing but for a far more reasonable price. Compared to the other Wuhan hotels this is the only one that offers international quality.
reviews.title: Always happy to be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is not new and this is reflected in the rate which is lower than most of Shangri-La hotels. And Wuhan is a 2nd tier city with huge contructions going on as you realize this once your limousine takes you to the hotel which takes almost an hour from the airport to the hotel you see hundreds of skyscrapers climbing up the sky and traffic is heavy all the day. Arriving at the hotel I was amazed as Concierge Lamia standing there to open the door of the car. She is extremly helpful and intelligent. The reason I give an excellent at Shangri-la Wuhan was that my room was not only the Horizon-Club-room but the presidential suite. This suite is huge and very luxury in every sense. This is probably to most prestigous address in Wuhan but it's only a one-bedroom suite by the way. The dinning area, the kitchen, the seperate sitting room, business-centre, the huge bathroom (better said Spa) with seperate bathroom, not to mention the TV-flats and now the best, I have never slept so comfortable in a premium city hotel like here. The bed is as big as you could take your family plus friends to sleep in it at the same time. As the bedroom is far away from any other rooms on the floor, nothing can disturb you from a good sleep. But yes, of course, the view over the city is something different but that's Wuhan. The suite itself is over 200sqm, that's enough to walk around the tables in the evening a bit and to relax yourself. Breakfast was in the Horizon Lounge, also very good. The 1-hour-massage was good as well, not a luxury room but fine related to the age of the hotel.
reviews.title: Very nice stay at the Shangrila

reviews.text: If you need a very relaxing and quiet night before an important meeting day, I highly recommed you try this suite , it's also called "Yangtze"-suite or presidential suite.
